intro: Raphionacme namibiana, commonly known as the Namibian star grass, is a flowering plant native to the Namib Desert. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers and succulent leaves adapted to arid conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access deep water sources in the dry environment. Raphionacme namibiana is an important component of the desert flora, contributing to soil stability and ecological balance.
